ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: days since consent
Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

ElementDescription: stepbd certification code
A=telephone in public fear. C=Fear-talking to classmates or others on the telephone
A=telephone in public avoid. C=Avoidance- talking to classmates or others on the telephone
A=participate in group fear. C=Fear- participating in work groups in the classroom
A=patricipate in group avoid. C=Avoidance- participating in work groups in the classroom
A=eat in public fear. C=Fear-eating in front of others (e.g., school cafeteria, restaurants)
A=eat in public avoid. C=Avoidance- eating in front of others (e.g., school cafeteria, restaurants)
drink in public fear
drink in public avoid
A=talk to authority fear. C=Fear -asking an adult you don't know well, like a store clerk, principal, or policeman for help (e.g., for directions or to explain something that you don't understand)

A=talk to authority avoid. C=Avoidance -asking an adult you don't know well, like a store clerk, principal, or policeman for help (e.g., for directions or to explain something that you don't understand)
A=acting giving talk fear. C=Fear -giving a verbal report or presentation in class (e.g., show and tell for younger children)
A=acting giving talk avoid. C=Avoidance -giving a verbal report or presentation in class (e.g., show and tell for younger children)
A=going to party fear. C=Fear -going to parties, dances, or school activities
A=going to party avoid. C=Avoidance -going to parties, dances, or school activities
working while observed fear
working while observed avoid
A=writing while observed fear. C=Fear -writing on the chalkboard or in front of others
A=writing while observed avoid. C=Avoidance -writing on the chalkboard or in front of others
calling someone new fear
calling someone new avoid

A=talk to someone new avoid. C=Avoidance -talking with other kids you don't know well
meet strangers fear
meet strangers avoid
A=urinating in public bath fear. C=Fear -using school or public bathrooms
A=urinating in public bath avoid. C=Avoidance -using school or public bathrooms
A=enter room other seated fear. C=Fear -going into a classroom or another place (e.g., Church, food court seating) when others are already seated
A=enter room other seated avoid. C=Avoidance -going into a classroom or another place (e.g., Church, food court seating) when others are already seated
A=center of attention fear. C=Fear -having people play close attention to you or being the center of attention (e.g., your own birthday party)
A=center of attention avoid. C=Avoidance -having people play close attention to you or being the center of attention (e.g., your own birthday party)
speaking at meeting fear
speaking at meeting avoid
taking test fear
taking test avoid
A=express disagreement fear. C=Fear -saying "no" to others when they ask you to do something that you don't want to do (like borrow something or look at your homework)
A=express disagreement avoid. C=Avoidance -saying "no" to others when they ask you to do something that you don't want to do (like borrow something or look at your homework)
A=look in the eyes fear. C=Fear -looking at people you don't know well in the eyes
A=look in the eyes avoid. C=Avoidance -looking at people you don't know well in the eyes
giving report to group fear
giving report to group avoid
try to pick up someone fear
try to pick up someone avoid

return goods to store avoid
